body.h1: About Friends of the Creative Domain
body.p: Friends of the Creative Domain was formed in mid 2004. Primarily created to encourage and support the BBC's efforts to make an open Creative Archive. It brought together groups who have a stake in the archive such as artists, archivists, academics, educators, and of course the license paying general public.
Since then it has retained its structure as a open community while the focus has evolved into a more general promotion of the public domain and of the creative commons.
The following groups are actively involved in organizing the FCD:

ul.li: CDR (Campaign for Digital Rights) and the OKF - Rufus Pollock
Creative Commons UK/PCMLP (Programme in Comparative Media Law and Policy) - Damian Tambini and Annabelle Littoz-Monnet
UPD (Union for the Public Domain) - David Tannenbaum
